txt.en: 'For the last few days, smoke has been rising from Makham Mijann, perhaps from a single camp-fire. I can't imagine anyone would be eager to hide out in an abandoned Corsair war-camp, unless they held some sort of ill intent.\n\n'Obviously, I cannot leave my post, but I see that you're quite familiar with adventuring. Will you investigate in my stead?'
The Corsair narrows his eyes at you

'Had I known what was happening at that camp-fire... but I did not, and he was beyond help. To die nameless and forsaken in an unfamiliar place... I only hope your actions gave him some semblance of peace.'

Halnith reaches down to gently pet the hound, who only responds with a tired thump of his tail.

'I daresay he's found his new home.' A smile breaks across Halnith's face. 'Guarding the beacon doesn't sound like such a lonely task anymore.'
Kakhât sniffs your hand. Before the hound leaves his master's side, he looks to him -- for further commands, perhaps. But the Corsair utters no more words.
Makham Mijann may not be fully abandoned.
